1.text: My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and wilt hide my commandments with thee,

2.text: That thy ear may hearken to wisdom: Incline thy heart to know prudence:

3.text: For if thou shalt call for wisdom, and incline thy heart to prudence:

4.text: If thou shalt seek her as money, and shalt dig for her as for a treasure:

5.text: Then shalt thou understand the fear of the Lord, and shalt find the knowledge of God.

6.text: Because the Lord giveth wisdom: and out of his mouth cometh prudence and knowledge.

7.text: He will keep the salvation of the righteous, and protect them that walk in simplicity.

8.text: Keeping the paths of justice, and guarding the ways of saints.

9.text: Then shalt thou understand justice, and judgment, and equity, and every good path.

10.text: If wisdom shall enter into thy heart, and knowledge please thy soul:

11.text: Counsel shall keep thee, and prudence shall preserve thee,

12.text: That thou mayst be delivered from the evil way, and from the man that speaketh perverse things:

13.text: Who leave the right way, and walk by dark ways:

14.text: Who are glad when they have done evil, and rejoice in most wicked things:

15.text: Whose ways are perverse, and their steps infamous.

16.text: That thou mayst be delivered from the strange women, and from the stranger, who softeneth her words:

17.text: And forsaketh the guide of her youth,

18.text: And hath forgotten the covenant of her God: for her house inclineth unto death, and her paths to hell.

19.text: None that go in unto her shall return again, neither shall they take hold of the paths of life,

20.text: That thou mayst walk in a good way: and mayst keep the paths of the just.

21.text: For they that are upright shall dwell in the earth, and the simple shall continue in it.

22.text: But the wicked shall be destroyed from the earth: and they that do unjustly shall be taken away from it.
